tutorial.speak:
The people tab of Chums helps you track key information on your members and visitors.
By default, you get a list of the 25 most recent additions.
You can use the search.
To find specific people.
You can also use the advanced search functionality to find people based on specific criteria.
For example, if we want to find men to invite to join the men's ministry.
We can search for men.
Who are 18 or older.
And are not already in the men's ministry.
We can also customize the results to include.
Additional information such as age and marital status.
If you have added custom fields, you could also include those values. We will cover those in another video.
Results can be sorted by any column and all lists can be exported to a CSV file to use with Excel or other spreadsheet programs.
Click on a person's name to view details.
You will see an overview of their information with the option to edit next to their name.
If you have added custom fields, you can view and edit those as well.
At the top of member details, you will see a notes icon with click notes to add more. These notes are only visible to staff members who can view the person's details.
Depending on your access, you may see additional tabs to view their attendance, as well as donations and groups.
Below his profile, you will see members of Robert's household with the option to edit.
You can set Robert's role as head of the household.
And his daughter as his child.
